content.question: ​A polynomial function has the form <math alttext="p open parentheses x close parentheses equals a x to the power of j plus b x to the power of k"><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mi>j</mi></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mi>k</mi></msup></math>, where <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math> and <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math> are nonzero constants, <math alttext="j"><mi>j</mi></math> and <math alttext="k"> <mi>k</mi> </math> are nonnegative integers. Which of the following conditions guarantees that <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> is an even function?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="j equals 2 k"><mi>j</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi></math> and <math alttext="k"> <mi>k</mi> </math> is even.

content.answer: ​<math alttext="j equals 2 k"><mi>j</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>k</mi></math> and <math alttext="k"> <mi>k</mi> </math> is even.
